Accelerated gradient descent

Initialize starting vector ğ¯(0)=ğ²(1)=ğ³(1)\mathbf{v}^{(0)} = \mathbf{y}^{(1)} = \mathbf{z}^{(1)}. For t=1,...,Tt = 1,...,T, compute

  • ğ²(t+1)=ğ±(t)âˆ’1Î²âˆ‡f(ğ±(t))\mathbf{y}^{(t+1)} = \mathbf{x}^{(t)}-\frac{1}{\beta}\nabla f(\mathbf{x}^{(t)})
  • ğ±(t+1)=(1+Îºâˆ’1Îº+1)ğ²(t+1)+Îºâˆ’1Îº+1(ğ²(t+1)âˆ’ğ²(t))\mathbf{x}^{(t+1)} = \left( 1 + \frac{\sqrt{\kappa}-1}{\sqrt{\kappa}+1} \right)\mathbf{y}^{(t+1)} + \frac{\sqrt{\kappa}-1}{\sqrt{\kappa}+1}\left(\mathbf{y}^{(t+1)} - \mathbf{y}^{(t)}\right)

Let ff be alpha-strongly convex and beta-smooth, then, running accelerated gradient descent for TT steps, output xÌ‚\hat{x} satisfies, with Îº=Î²Î±\kappa = \frac{\beta}{\alpha} ,

f(ğ±(T))âˆ’f(ğ±*)â‰¤Îºeâˆ’T/Îº[f(ğ±(0))âˆ’f(ğ±*)]f(\mathbf{x}^{(T)}) - f(\mathbf{x}^*) \leq \kappa e^{-T/\sqrt{\kappa}}[f(\mathbf{x}^{(0)})-f(\mathbf{x}^*)]

Complexity analysis:

Suppose ff strongly convex such that mIâ‰¼âˆ‡2f(x)â‰¼MI,for all xmI \preceq \nabla^2 f(x) \preceq MI, \quad \text{for all } x Recall that setting t=1/Mt = 1/M, f(x(k))âˆ’p*â‰¤(1âˆ’1Îº)k(f(x(0)âˆ’p*)f(x^{(k)}) - p^* \leq (1- \frac{1}{\kappa})^k (f(x^{(0)} - p^*) where Îº=M/m\kappa = M/m, and p*p^* is the minimum value of ff.
